tools.name: read_file
tools.description: Read the complete contents of a file from the file system. Handles various text encodings and provides detailed error messages if the file cannot be read. Use this tool when you need to examine the contents of a single file. Only works within allowed directories.

tools.name: read_multiple_files
tools.description: Read the contents of multiple files simultaneously. This is more efficient than reading files one by one when you need to analyze or compare multiple files. Each file's content is returned with its path as a reference. Failed reads for individual files won't stop the entire operation. Only works within allowed directories.

tools.name: write_file
tools.description: Create a new file or completely overwrite an existing file with new content. Use with caution as it will overwrite existing files without warning. Handles text content with proper encoding. Only works within allowed directories.

tools.name: edit_file
tools.description: Make line-based edits to a text file. Each edit replaces exact line sequences with new content. Returns a git-style diff showing the changes made. Only works within allowed directories.

oldText.description: Text to search for - must match exactly

dryRun.description: Preview changes using git-style diff format

tools.name: create_directory
tools.description: Create a new directory or ensure a directory exists. Can create multiple nested directories in one operation. If the directory already exists, this operation will succeed silently. Perfect for setting up directory structures for projects or ensuring required paths exist. Only works within allowed directories.

tools.name: list_directory
tools.description: Get a detailed listing of all files and directories in a specified path. Results clearly distinguish between files and directories with [FILE] and [DIR] prefixes. This tool is essential for understanding directory structure and finding specific files within a directory. Only works within allowed directories.

tools.name: directory_tree
tools.description: Get a recursive tree view of files and directories as a JSON structure. Each entry includes 'name', 'type' (file/directory), and 'children' for directories. Files have no children array, while directories always have a children array (which may be empty). The output is formatted with 2-space indentation for readability. Only works within allowed directories.

tools.name: move_file
tools.description: Move or rename files and directories. Can move files between directories and rename them in a single operation. If the destination exists, the operation will fail. Works across different directories and can be used for simple renaming within the same directory. Both source and destination must be within allowed directories.

tools.name: search_files
tools.description: Recursively search for files and directories matching a pattern. Searches through all subdirectories from the starting path. The search is case-insensitive and matches partial names. Returns full paths to all matching items. Great for finding files when you don't know their exact location. Only searches within allowed directories.

tools.name: get_file_info
tools.description: Retrieve detailed metadata about a file or directory. Returns comprehensive information including size, creation time, last modified time, permissions, and type. This tool is perfect for understanding file characteristics without reading the actual content. Only works within allowed directories.

tools.name: list_allowed_directories
tools.description: Returns the list of directories that this server is allowed to access. Use this to understand which directories are available before trying to access files.

message.content:
Sure, here are the general steps to shut down your laptop, depending on your operating system:

### For Windows:
1. **Save your work:** Make sure to save any open documents or files.
2. **Click the Start icon:** It's typically located at the bottom-left corner of the screen.
3. **Select the Power button:** In the Start menu or by clicking the power icon.
4. **Click "Shut down":** From the options provided, select "Shut down."

### For macOS:
1. **Save your work:** Ensure all your open files are saved.
2. **Click the Apple logo:** Located at the top left of your screen.
3. **Select "Shut Down":** Click "Shut Down" from the drop-down menu.
4. **Confirm:** If prompted, confirm to shut down the laptop.

### For Linux:
1. **Save your work:** As usual, save any open files.
2. **Open the system menu:** Either by clicking on the power or settings icon usually available in the top-right corner, or in the bottom-left corner, depending on your distribution.
3. **Select "Shut down" or "Power off":** Choose the appropriate option to turn off your laptop.

Once you follow these steps, your laptop should begin the process of shutting down. If it doesn't turn off due to software issues, pressing and holding the physical power button for a few seconds usually forces it to shut down (though this is not recommended as a regular practice).

### For Windows:
1. **Save your work:** Make sure to save any open documents or files.
2. **Click the Start icon:** It's typically located at the bottom-left corner of the screen.
3. **Select the Power button:** In the Start menu or by clicking the power icon.
4. **Click "Shut down":** From the options provided, select "Shut down."

### For macOS:
1. **Save your work:** Ensure all your open files are saved.
2. **Click the Apple logo:** Located at the top left of your screen.

4. **Confirm:** If prompted, confirm to shut down the laptop.

### For Linux:
1. **Save your work:** As usual, save any open files.
2. **Open the system menu:** Either by clicking on the power or settings icon usually available in the top-right corner, or in the bottom-left corner, depending on your distribution.
3. **Select "Shut down" or "Power off":** Choose the appropriate option to turn off your laptop.

tools.name: read_file
tools.description: Read the complete contents of a file from the file system. Handles various text encodings and provides detailed error messages if the file cannot be read. Use this tool when you need to examine the contents of a single file. Only works within allowed directories.

tools.name: read_multiple_files
tools.description: Read the contents of multiple files simultaneously. This is more efficient than reading files one by one when you need to analyze or compare multiple files. Each file's content is returned with its path as a reference. Failed reads for individual files won't stop the entire operation. Only works within allowed directories.

tools.name: write_file
tools.description: Create a new file or completely overwrite an existing file with new content. Use with caution as it will overwrite existing files without warning. Handles text content with proper encoding. Only works within allowed directories.

tools.name: edit_file
tools.description: Make line-based edits to a text file. Each edit replaces exact line sequences with new content. Returns a git-style diff showing the changes made. Only works within allowed directories.

oldText.description: Text to search for - must match exactly

dryRun.description: Preview changes using git-style diff format

tools.name: create_directory
tools.description: Create a new directory or ensure a directory exists. Can create multiple nested directories in one operation. If the directory already exists, this operation will succeed silently. Perfect for setting up directory structures for projects or ensuring required paths exist. Only works within allowed directories.

tools.name: list_directory
tools.description: Get a detailed listing of all files and directories in a specified path. Results clearly distinguish between files and directories with [FILE] and [DIR] prefixes. This tool is essential for understanding directory structure and finding specific files within a directory. Only works within allowed directories.

tools.name: directory_tree
tools.description: Get a recursive tree view of files and directories as a JSON structure. Each entry includes 'name', 'type' (file/directory), and 'children' for directories. Files have no children array, while directories always have a children array (which may be empty). The output is formatted with 2-space indentation for readability. Only works within allowed directories.

tools.name: move_file
tools.description: Move or rename files and directories. Can move files between directories and rename them in a single operation. If the destination exists, the operation will fail. Works across different directories and can be used for simple renaming within the same directory. Both source and destination must be within allowed directories.

tools.name: search_files
tools.description: Recursively search for files and directories matching a pattern. Searches through all subdirectories from the starting path. The search is case-insensitive and matches partial names. Returns full paths to all matching items. Great for finding files when you don't know their exact location. Only searches within allowed directories.

tools.name: get_file_info
tools.description: Retrieve detailed metadata about a file or directory. Returns comprehensive information including size, creation time, last modified time, permissions, and type. This tool is perfect for understanding file characteristics without reading the actual content. Only works within allowed directories.

tools.name: list_allowed_directories
tools.description: Returns the list of directories that this server is allowed to access. Use this to understand which directories are available before trying to access files.

Sure, here are the general steps to shut down your laptop, depending on your operating system:

### For Windows:
1. **Save your work:** Make sure to save any open documents or files.
2. **Click the Start icon:** It's typically located at the bottom-left corner of the screen.
3. **Select the Power button:** In the Start menu or by clicking the power icon.
4. **Click "Shut down":** From the options provided, select "Shut down."

### For macOS:
1. **Save your work:** Ensure all your open files are saved.
2. **Click the Apple logo:** Located at the top left of your screen.
3. **Select "Shut Down":** Click "Shut Down" from the drop-down menu.
4. **Confirm:** If prompted, confirm to shut down the laptop.

### For Linux:
1. **Save your work:** As usual, save any open files.
2. **Open the system menu:** Either by clicking on the power or settings icon usually available in the top-right corner, or in the bottom-left corner, depending on your distribution.
3. **Select "Shut down" or "Power off":** Choose the appropriate option to turn off your laptop.

Once you follow these steps, your laptop should begin the process of shutting down. If it doesn't turn off due to software issues, pressing and holding the physical power button for a few seconds usually forces it to shut down (though this is not recommended as a regular practice).

request._content: b'{"max_tokens":2048,"messages":[{"role":"user","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\\nYou are an expert evaluator for content quality. Your task is to evaluate a response against the user\'s original request.\\n\\nEvaluate the response for iteration 1 and provide structured feedback on its quality and areas for improvement.\\n\\n<fastagent:data>\\n<fastagent:request>\\n\\n        Requirements: data/files\\n        Prepare chicken 65 with medium spice level and use 4-5 servings prepared with minimal oil in air fryer.\\n        \\n</fastagent:request>\\n\\n<fastagent:response>\\n# Chicken 65 Recipe Strategy Document\\n\\n## Executive Summary\\nThis document outlines a detailed strategy for preparing Chicken 65 at a medium spice level, suitable for 4-5 servings, using minimal oil in an air fryer. The strategy focuses on maintaining authentic flavors while adapting the traditional deep-frying method to a healthier air fryer approach.\\n\\n## Requirements Analysis\\n\\n### Key Requirements:\\n- Prepare Chicken 65\\n- Medium spice level\\n- Yield: 4-5 servings\\n- Cooking method: Air fryer\\n- Minimal oil usage\\n\\n### Constraints:\\n- Must retain authentic Chicken 65 flavor profile\\n- Must achieve proper texture (crispy exterior, juicy interior)\\n- Must accommodate medium spice tolerance\\n- Must be efficiently prepared using an air fryer\\n\\n## Ingredient Strategy\\n\\n### Primary Ingredients:\\n- **Chicken:** 1.5 pounds (700g) boneless chicken thighs, cut into 1-inch cubes\\n- **Marinade Base:**\\n  - 1 cup plain yogurt\\n  - 2 tablespoons lemon juice\\n  - 1 tablespoon ginger-garlic paste\\n  - 1 teaspoon salt\\n\\n### Spice Components (Medium Level):\\n- 1.5 teaspoons Kashmiri red chili powder (provides color with moderate heat)\\n- 1 teaspoon regular red chili powder (can be adjusted \xc2\xb10.5 tsp for spice preference)\\n- 1 teaspoon coriander powder\\n- 1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder\\n- 1/2 teaspoon garam masala\\n- 1/4 teaspoon black pepper\\n\\n### Coating Components:\\n- 3 tablespoons corn starch or rice flour\\n- 1 egg (beaten)\\n\\n### Oil Usage Strategy:\\n- 2 tablespoons oil for marination\\n- Cooking spray for air fryer basket\\n\\n### Tempering/Garnish Components:\\n- 1 tablespoon oil\\n- 2-3 dried red chilies (optional)\\n- 10-12 curry leaves\\n- 2 green chilies, slit (optional - for authentic appearance)\\n- 1 tablespoon minced garlic\\n- 1/2 teaspoon mustard seeds\\n- Chopped cilantro for garnish\\n- Lemon wedges for serving\\n\\n## Process Flow Diagram\\n\\n```\\n[Chicken Preparation] \xe2\x86\x92 [Marination (4+ hours)] \xe2\x86\x92 [Add Coating] \xe2\x86\x92 [Air Fry] \xe2\x86\x92 [Optional Tempering] \xe2\x86\x92 [Garnish and Serve]\\n```\\n\\n## Detailed Process Strategy\\n\\n### Phase 1: Preparation and Marination\\n1. **Chicken Preparation:**\\n   - Clean and pat dry chicken pieces\\n   - Cut into 1-inch cubes for even cooking\\n   - Ensure uniform size for consistent cooking\\n\\n2. **Marination:**\\n   - Combine all marinade and spice components in a large bowl\\n   - Mix thoroughly to create a uniform marinade\\n   - Add chicken pieces and coat completely\\n   - Cover and refrigerate for minimum 4 hours (preferably overnight)\\n\\n### Phase 2: Air Fryer Execution\\n1. **Pre-Cooking Preparation:**\\n   - Preheat air fryer to 380\xc2\xb0F (193\xc2\xb0C) for 3 minutes\\n   - Remove marinated chicken from refrigerator 20 minutes before cooking\\n   - Add corn starch/rice flour and beaten egg to marinated chicken\\n   - Mix thoroughly to ensure even coating\\n\\n2. **Air Frying Process:**\\n   - Lightly spray air fryer basket with cooking spray\\n   - Arrange chicken pieces in a single layer with small gaps between pieces\\n   - Cook in batches if necessary to avoid overcrowding\\n   - Air fry at 380\xc2\xb0F for 12 minutes\\n   - Flip chicken pieces halfway through cooking (at 6-minute mark)\\n   - Check internal temperature (should reach 165\xc2\xb0F/74\xc2\xb0C)\\n\\n### Phase 3: Optional Tempering (For Authentic Finish)\\n1. **Tempering Preparation:**\\n   - Heat 1 tablespoon oil in a small pan\\n   - Add mustard seeds and let them splutter\\n   - Add dried red chilies, curry leaves, green chilies, and minced garlic\\n   - Saut\xc3\xa9 for 30 seconds until aromatic\\n\\n2. **Final Assembly:**\\n   - Transfer air-fried chicken to a mixing bowl\\n   - Pour the tempering mixture over the chicken\\n   - Toss gently to coat evenly\\n   - Garnish with chopped cilantro\\n   - Serve hot with lemon wedges\\n\\n## Key Performance Indicators\\n\\n### Texture Metrics:\\n- Exterior should be crispy and lightly browned\\n- Interior should remain juicy and tender\\n- Chicken should be fully cooked (165\xc2\xb0F/74\xc2\xb0C internal temperature)\\n\\n### Flavor Metrics:\\n- Medium spice level that provides warmth without overwhelming heat\\n- Balanced flavor profile with tangy, spicy, and aromatic elements\\n- Authentic curry leaf and mustard seed notes\\n\\n### Appearance Metrics:\\n- Vibrant reddish-orange color\\n- Even browning\\n- Visible spice coating\\n\\n## Risk Mitigation\\n\\n### Potential Issues and Solutions:\\n1. **Undercooking:**\\n   - Solution: Use a meat thermometer to verify internal temperature\\n   - Contingency: Add 2-3 minutes additional cooking time if needed\\n\\n2. **Dry Texture:**\\n   - Solution: Ensure adequate marination time (minimum 4 hours)\\n   - Contingency: Rest chicken at room temperature 20 minutes before cooking\\n\\n3. **Insufficient Crispiness:**\\n   - Solution: Ensure chicken pieces aren\'t overcrowded in air fryer\\n   - Contingency: Increase temperature to 400\xc2\xb0F for last 2 minutes of cooking\\n\\n4. **Spice Level Adjustment:**\\n   - Solution: Prepare a small sample piece to test spice level\\n   - Contingency: Add yogurt-based dipping sauce to moderate heat if too spicy\\n\\n## Implementation Schedule\\n\\n1. **Day Before:**\\n   - Purchase ingredients\\n   - Clean and cut chicken\\n   - Prepare marinade and combine with chicken\\n   - Refrigerate overnight\\n\\n2. **Day of Serving:**\\n   - Remove chicken from refrigerator 20 minutes before cooking\\n   - Prepare air fryer and additional coating ingredients\\n   - Cook chicken in batches as needed\\n   - Prepare tempering if desired\\n   - Garnish and serve immediately\\n\\n## Conclusion\\nThis strategy provides a comprehensive approach to creating Chicken 65 that balances authentic flavor with healthier cooking methods. By following this document, you will achieve a medium-spiced Chicken 65 with minimal oil usage while maintaining the dish\'s essential characteristics and serving 4-5 people effectively.\\n</fastagent:response>\\n</fastagent:data>\\n\\n<fastagent:instruction>\\nYour response MUST be valid JSON matching this exact format (no other text, markdown, or explanation):\\n\\n{\\n  \\"rating\\": \\"RATING\\",\\n  \\"feedback\\": \\"DETAILED FEEDBACK\\",\\n  \\"needs_improvement\\": BOOLEAN,\\n  \\"focus_areas\\": [\\"FOCUS_AREA_1\\", \\"FOCUS_AREA_2\\", \\"FOCUS_AREA_3\\"]\\n}\\n\\nWhere:\\n- RATING: Must be one of: \\"EXCELLENT\\", \\"GOOD\\", \\"FAIR\\", or \\"POOR\\"\\n  - EXCELLENT: No improvements needed\\n  - GOOD: Only minor improvements possible\\n  - FAIR: Several improvements needed\\n  - POOR: Major improvements needed\\n- DETAILED FEEDBACK: Specific, actionable feedback (as a single string)\\n- BOOLEAN: true or false (lowercase, no quotes) indicating if further improvement is needed\\n- FOCUS_AREAS: Array of 1-3 specific areas to focus on (empty array if no improvement needed)\\n\\nExample of valid response (DO NOT include the triple backticks in your response):\\n{\\n  \\"rating\\": \\"GOOD\\",\\n  \\"feedback\\": \\"The response is clear but could use more supporting evidence.\\",\\n  \\"needs_improvement\\": true,\\n  \\"focus_areas\\": [\\"Add more examples\\", \\"Include data points\\"]\\n}\\n\\nIMPORTANT: Your response should be ONLY the JSON object without any code fences, explanations, or other text.\\n</fastagent:instruction>\\n"}]}],"model":"claude-3-7-sonnet","stop_sequences":null,"system":"You are a helpful agent.","tools":[]}'

The strategy focuses on maintaining authentic flavors while adapting the traditional deep-frying method to a healthier air fryer approach.\\n\\n## Requirements Analysis\\n\\n### Key Requirements:\\n- Prepare Chicken 65\\n- Medium spice level\\n- Yield: 4-5 servings\\n- Cooking method: Air fryer\\n- Minimal oil usage\\n\\n### Constraints:\\n- Must retain authentic Chicken 65 flavor profile\\n- Must achieve proper texture (crispy exterior, juicy interior)\\n- Must accommodate medium spice tolerance\\n- Must be efficiently prepared using an air fryer\\n\\n## Ingredient Strategy\\n\\n### Primary Ingredients:\\n- **Chicken:** 1.5 pounds (700g) boneless chicken thighs, cut into 1-inch cubes\\n- **Marinade Base:**\\n  - 1 cup plain yogurt\\n  - 2 tablespoons lemon juice\\n  - 1 tablespoon ginger-garlic paste\\n  - 1 teaspoon salt\\n\\n### Spice Components (Medium Level):\\n- 1.5 teaspoons Kashmiri red chili powder (provides color with moderate heat)\\n- 1 teaspoon regular red chili powder (can be adjusted \xc2\xb10.5 tsp for spice preference)\\n- 1 teaspoon coriander powder\\n- 1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder\\n- 1/2 teaspoon garam masala\\n- 1/4 teaspoon black pepper\\n\\n### Coating Components:\\n- 3 tablespoons corn starch or rice flour\\n- 1 egg (beaten)\\n\\n### Oil Usage Strategy:\\n- 2 tablespoons oil for marination\\n- Cooking spray for air fryer basket\\n\\n### Tempering/Garnish Components:\\n- 1 tablespoon oil\\n- 2-3 dried red chilies (optional)\\n- 10-12 curry leaves\\n- 2 green chilies, slit (optional - for authentic appearance)\\n- 1 tablespoon minced garlic\\n- 1/2 teaspoon mustard seeds\\n- Chopped cilantro for garnish\\n- Lemon wedges for serving\\n\\n## Process Flow Diagram\\n\\n```\\n[Chicken Preparation] \xe2\x86\x92 [Marination (4+ hours)] \xe2\x86\x92 [Add Coating] \xe2\x86\x92 [Air Fry] \xe2\x86\x92 [Optional Tempering] \xe2\x86\x92 [Garnish and Serve]\\n```\\n\\n## Detailed Process Strategy\\n\\n### Phase 1: Preparation and Marination\\n1. **Chicken Preparation:**\\n   - Clean and pat dry chicken pieces\\n   - Cut into 1-inch cubes for even cooking\\n   - Ensure uniform size for consistent cooking\\n\\n2. **Marination:**\\n   - Combine all marinade and spice components in a large bowl\\n   - Mix thoroughly to create a uniform marinade\\n   - Add chicken pieces and coat completely\\n   - Cover and refrigerate for minimum 4 hours (preferably overnight)\\n\\n### Phase 2: Air Fryer Execution\\n1. **Pre-Cooking Preparation:**\\n   - Preheat air fryer to 380\xc2\xb0F (193\xc2\xb0C) for 3 minutes\\n   - Remove marinated chicken from refrigerator 20 minutes before cooking\\n   - Add corn starch/rice flour and beaten egg to marinated chicken\\n   - Mix thoroughly to ensure even coating\\n\\n2. **Air Frying Process:**\\n   - Lightly spray air fryer basket with cooking spray\\n   - Arrange chicken pieces in a single layer with small gaps between pieces\\n   - Cook in batches if necessary to avoid overcrowding\\n   - Air fry at 380\xc2\xb0F for 12 minutes\\n   - Flip chicken pieces halfway through cooking (at 6-minute mark)\\n   - Check internal temperature (should reach 165\xc2\xb0F/74\xc2\xb0C)\\n\\n### Phase 3: Optional Tempering (For Authentic Finish)\\n1. **Tempering Preparation:**\\n   - Heat 1 tablespoon oil in a small pan\\n   - Add mustard seeds and let them splutter\\n   - Add dried red chilies, curry leaves, green chilies, and minced garlic\\n   - Saut\xc3\xa9 for 30 seconds until aromatic\\n\\n2. **Final Assembly:**\\n   - Transfer air-fried chicken to a mixing bowl\\n   - Pour the tempering mixture over the chicken\\n   - Toss gently to coat evenly\\n   - Garnish with chopped cilantro\\n   - Serve hot with lemon wedges\\n\\n## Key Performance Indicators\\n\\n### Texture Metrics:\\n- Exterior should be crispy and lightly browned\\n- Interior should remain juicy and tender\\n- Chicken should be fully cooked (165\xc2\xb0F/74\xc2\xb0C internal temperature)\\n\\n### Flavor Metrics:\\n- Medium spice level that provides warmth without overwhelming heat\\n- Balanced flavor profile with tangy, spicy, and aromatic elements\\n- Authentic curry leaf and mustard seed notes\\n\\n### Appearance Metrics:\\n- Vibrant reddish-orange color\\n- Even browning\\n- Visible spice coating\\n\\n## Risk Mitigation\\n\\n### Potential Issues and Solutions:\\n1. **Undercooking:**\\n   - Solution: Use a meat thermometer to verify internal temperature\\n   - Contingency: Add 2-3 minutes additional cooking time if needed\\n\\n2. **Dry Texture:**\\n   - Solution: Ensure adequate marination time (minimum 4 hours)\\n   - Contingency: Rest chicken at room temperature 20 minutes before cooking\\n\\n3. **Insufficient Crispiness:**\\n   - Solution: Ensure chicken pieces aren\'t overcrowded in air fryer\\n   - Contingency: Increase temperature to 400\xc2\xb0F for last 2 minutes of cooking\\n\\n4. **Spice Level Adjustment:**\\n   - Solution: Prepare a small sample piece to test spice level\\n   - Contingency: Add yogurt-based dipping sauce to moderate heat if too spicy\\n\\n## Implementation Schedule\\n\\n1. **Day Before:**\\n   - Purchase ingredients\\n   - Clean and cut chicken\\n   - Prepare marinade and combine with chicken\\n   - Refrigerate overnight\\n\\n2. **Day of Serving:**\\n   - Remove chicken from refrigerator 20 minutes before cooking\\n   - Prepare air fryer and additional coating ingredients\\n   - Cook chicken in batches as needed\\n   - Prepare tempering if desired\\n   - Garnish and serve immediately\\n\\n## Conclusion\\nThis strategy provides a comprehensive approach to creating Chicken 65 that balances authentic flavor with healthier cooking methods. for authentic appearance)\\n- 1 tablespoon minced garlic\\n- 1/2 teaspoon mustard seeds\\n- Chopped cilantro for garnish\\n- Lemon wedges for serving\\n\\n## Process Flow Diagram\\n\\n```\\n[Chicken Preparation] \xe2\x86\x92 [Marination (4+ hours)] \xe2\x86\x92 [Add Coating] \xe2\x86\x92 [Air Fry] \xe2\x86\x92 [Optional Tempering] \xe2\x86\x92 [Garnish and Serve]\\n```\\n\\n## Detailed Process Strategy\\n\\n### Phase 1: Preparation and Marination\\n1. **Chicken Preparation:**\\n   - Clean and pat dry chicken pieces\\n   - Cut into 1-inch cubes for even cooking\\n   - Ensure uniform size for consistent cooking\\n\\n2. **Marination:**\\n   - Combine all marinade and spice components in a large bowl\\n   - Mix thoroughly to create a uniform marinade\\n   - Add chicken pieces and coat completely\\n   - Cover and refrigerate for minimum 4 hours (preferably overnight)\\n\\n### Phase 2: Air Fryer Execution\\n1. **Pre-Cooking Preparation:**\\n   - Preheat air fryer to 380\xc2\xb0F (193\xc2\xb0C) for 3 minutes\\n   - Remove marinated chicken from refrigerator 20 minutes before cooking\\n   - Add corn starch/rice flour and beaten egg to marinated chicken\\n   - Mix thoroughly to ensure even coating\\n\\n2. **Air Frying Process:**\\n   - Lightly spray air fryer basket with cooking spray\\n   - Arrange chicken pieces in a single layer with small gaps between pieces\\n   - Cook in batches if necessary to avoid overcrowding\\n   - Air fry at 380\xc2\xb0F for 12 minutes\\n   - Flip chicken pieces halfway through cooking (at 6-minute mark)\\n   - Check internal temperature (should reach 165\xc2\xb0F/74\xc2\xb0C)\\n\\n### Phase 3: Optional Tempering (For Authentic Finish)\\n1. **Tempering Preparation:**\\n   - Transfer air-fried chicken to a mixing bowl\\n   - Pour the tempering mixture over the chicken\\n   - Toss gently to coat evenly\\n   - Garnish with chopped cilantro\\n   - Serve hot with lemon wedges\\n\\n## Key Performance Indicators\\n\\n### Texture Metrics:\\n- Exterior should be crispy and lightly browned\\n- Interior should remain juicy and tender\\n- Chicken should be fully cooked (165\xc2\xb0F/74\xc2\xb0C internal temperature)\\n\\n### Flavor Metrics:\\n- Medium spice level that provides warmth without overwhelming heat\\n- Balanced flavor profile with tangy, spicy, and aromatic elements\\n- Authentic curry leaf and mustard seed notes\\n\\n### Appearance Metrics:\\n- Vibrant reddish-orange color\\n- Even browning\\n- Visible spice coating\\n\\n## Risk Mitigation\\n\\n### Potential Issues and Solutions:\\n1. **Undercooking:**\\n   - Solution: Use a meat thermometer to verify internal temperature\\n   - Contingency: Add 2-3 minutes additional cooking time if needed\\n\\n2. **Dry Texture:**\\n   - Solution: Ensure adequate marination time (minimum 4 hours)\\n   - The strategy focuses on maintaining authentic flavors while adapting the traditional deep-frying method to a healthier air fryer approach.\\n\\n## Requirements Analysis\\n\\n### Key Requirements:\\n- Prepare Chicken 65\\n- Medium spice level\\n- Yield: 4-5 servings\\n- Cooking method: Air fryer\\n- Minimal oil usage\\n\\n### Constraints:\\n- Must retain authentic Chicken 65 flavor profile\\n- Must achieve proper texture (crispy exterior, juicy interior)\\n- Must accommodate medium spice tolerance\\n- Must be efficiently prepared using an air fryer\\n\\n## Ingredient Strategy\\n\\n### Primary Ingredients:\\n- **Chicken:** 1.5 pounds (700g) boneless chicken thighs, cut into 1-inch cubes\\n- **Marinade Base:**\\n  - 1 cup plain yogurt\\n  - 2 tablespoons lemon juice\\n  - 1 tablespoon ginger-garlic paste\\n  - 1 teaspoon salt\\n\\n### Spice Components (Medium Level):\\n- 1.5 teaspoons Kashmiri red chili powder (provides color with moderate heat)\\n- 1 teaspoon regular red chili powder (can be adjusted \xc2\xb10.5 tsp for spice preference)\\n- 1 teaspoon coriander powder\\n- 1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder\\n- 1/2 teaspoon garam masala\\n- 1/4 teaspoon black pepper\\n\\n### Coating Components:\\n- 3 tablespoons corn starch or rice flour\\n- 1 egg (beaten)\\n\\n### Oil Usage Strategy:\\n- 2 tablespoons oil for marination\\n- Cooking spray for air fryer basket\\n\\n### Tempering/Garnish Components:\\n- 1 tablespoon oil\\n- 2-3 dried red chilies (optional)\\n- 10-12 curry leaves\\n- 2 green chilies, slit (optional - for authentic appearance)\\n- 1 tablespoon minced garlic\\n- 1/2 teaspoon mustard seeds\\n- Chopped cilantro for garnish\\n- Lemon wedges for serving\\n\\n## Process Flow Diagram\\n\\n```\\n[Chicken Preparation] \xe2\x86\x92 [Marination (4+ hours)] \xe2\x86\x92 [Add Coating] \xe2\x86\x92 [Air Fry] \xe2\x86\x92 [Optional Tempering] \xe2\x86\x92 [Garnish and Serve]\\n```\\n\\n## Detailed Process Strategy\\n\\n### Phase 1: Preparation and Marination\\n1. **Chicken Preparation:**\\n   - Clean and pat dry chicken pieces\\n   - Cut into 1-inch cubes for even cooking\\n   - Ensure uniform size for consistent cooking\\n\\n2. **Marination:**\\n   - Combine all marinade and spice components in a large bowl\\n   - Mix thoroughly to create a uniform marinade\\n   - Add chicken pieces and coat completely\\n   - Cover and refrigerate for minimum 4 hours (preferably overnight)\\n\\n### Phase 2: Air Fryer Execution\\n1. **Pre-Cooking Preparation:**\\n   - Preheat air fryer to 380\xc2\xb0F (193\xc2\xb0C) for 3 minutes\\n   - Remove marinated chicken from refrigerator 20 minutes before cooking\\n   - Add corn starch/rice flour and beaten egg to marinated chicken\\n   - Mix thoroughly to ensure even coating\\n\\n2. **Air Frying Process:**\\n   - Lightly spray air fryer basket with cooking spray\\n   - Arrange chicken pieces in a single layer with small gaps between pieces\\n   - Cook in batches if necessary to avoid overcrowding\\n   - Air fry at 380\xc2\xb0F for 12 minutes\\n   - Flip chicken pieces halfway through cooking (at 6-minute mark)\\n   - Check internal temperature (should reach 165\xc2\xb0F/74\xc2\xb0C)\\n\\n### Phase 3: Optional Tempering (For Authentic Finish)\\n1. **Tempering Preparation:**\\n   - Heat 1 tablespoon oil in a small pan\\n   - Add mustard seeds and let them splutter\\n   - Add dried red chilies, curry leaves, green chilies, and minced garlic\\n   - Saut\xc3\xa9 for 30 seconds until aromatic\\n\\n2. **Final Assembly:**\\n   - Transfer air-fried chicken to a mixing bowl\\n   - Pour the tempering mixture over the chicken\\n   - Toss gently to coat evenly\\n   - Garnish with chopped cilantro\\n   - Serve hot with lemon wedges\\n\\n## Key Performance Indicators\\n\\n### Texture Metrics:\\n- Exterior should be crispy and lightly browned\\n- Interior should remain juicy and tender\\n- Chicken should be fully cooked (165\xc2\xb0F/74\xc2\xb0C internal temperature)\\n\\n### Flavor Metrics:\\n- Medium spice level that provides warmth without overwhelming heat\\n- Balanced flavor profile with tangy, spicy, and aromatic elements\\n- Authentic curry leaf and mustard seed notes\\n\\n### Appearance Metrics:\\n- Vibrant reddish-orange color\\n- Even browning\\n- Visible spice coating\\n\\n## Risk Mitigation\\n\\n### Potential Issues and Solutions:\\n1. **Undercooking:**\\n   - Solution: Use a meat thermometer to verify internal temperature\\n   - Contingency: Add 2-3 minutes additional cooking time if needed\\n\\n2. **Dry Texture:**\\n   - Solution: Ensure adequate marination time (minimum 4 hours)\\n   - Contingency: Rest chicken at room temperature 20 minutes before cooking\\n\\n3. **Insufficient Crispiness:**\\n   - Solution: Ensure chicken pieces aren\'t overcrowded in air fryer\\n   - Contingency: Increase temperature to 400\xc2\xb0F for last 2 minutes of cooking\\n\\n4. **Spice Level Adjustment:**\\n   - Solution: Prepare a small sample piece to test spice level\\n   - Contingency: Add yogurt-based dipping sauce to moderate heat if too spicy\\n\\n## Implementation Schedule\\n\\n1. **Day Before:**\\n   - Purchase ingredients\\n   - Clean and cut chicken\\n   - Prepare marinade and combine with chicken\\n   - Refrigerate overnight\\n\\n2. **Day of Serving:**\\n   - Remove chicken from refrigerator 20 minutes before cooking\\n   - Prepare air fryer and additional coating ingredients\\n   - Cook chicken in batches as needed\\n   - Prepare tempering if desired\\n   - Garnish and serve immediately\\n\\n## Conclusion\\nThis strategy provides a comprehensive approach to creating Chicken 65 that balances authentic flavor with healthier cooking methods. The strategy focuses on maintaining authentic flavors while adapting the traditional deep-frying method to a healthier air fryer approach.\\n\\n## Requirements Analysis\\n\\n### Key Requirements:\\n- Prepare Chicken 65\\n- Medium spice level\\n- Yield: 4-5 servings\\n- Cooking method: Air fryer\\n- Minimal oil usage\\n\\n### Constraints:\\n- Must retain authentic Chicken 65 flavor profile\\n- Must achieve proper texture (crispy exterior, juicy interior)\\n- Must accommodate medium spice tolerance\\n- Must be efficiently prepared using an air fryer\\n\\n## Ingredient Strategy\\n\\n### Primary Ingredients:\\n- **Chicken:** 1.5 pounds (700g) boneless chicken thighs, cut into 1-inch cubes\\n- **Marinade Base:**\\n  - 1 cup plain yogurt\\n  - 2 tablespoons lemon juice\\n  - 1 tablespoon ginger-garlic paste\\n  - 1 teaspoon salt\\n\\n### Spice Components (Medium Level):\\n- 1.5 teaspoons Kashmiri red chili powder (provides color with moderate heat)\\n- 1 teaspoon regular red chili powder (can be adjusted \xc2\xb10.5 tsp for spice preference)\\n- 1 teaspoon coriander powder\\n- 1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder\\n- 1/2 teaspoon garam masala\\n- 1/4 teaspoon black pepper\\n\\n### Coating Components:\\n- 3 tablespoons corn starch or rice flour\\n- 1 egg (beaten)\\n\\n### Oil Usage Strategy:\\n- 2 tablespoons oil for marination\\n- Cooking spray for air fryer basket\\n\\n### Tempering/Garnish Components:\\n- 1 tablespoon oil\\n- 2-3 dried red chilies (optional)\\n- 10-12 curry leaves\\n- 2 green chilies, slit (optional - for authentic appearance)\\n- 1 tablespoon minced garlic\\n- 1/2 teaspoon mustard seeds\\n- Chopped cilantro for garnish\\n- Lemon wedges for serving\\n\\n## Process Flow Diagram\\n\\n```\\n[Chicken Preparation] \xe2\x86\x92 [Marination (4+ hours)] \xe2\x86\x92 [Add Coating] \xe2\x86\x92 [Air Fry] \xe2\x86\x92 [Optional Tempering] \xe2\x86\x92 [Garnish and Serve]\\n```\\n\\n## Detailed Process Strategy\\n\\n### Phase 1: Preparation and Marination\\n1. **Chicken Preparation:**\\n   - Clean and pat dry chicken pieces\\n   - Cut into 1-inch cubes for even cooking\\n   - Ensure uniform size for consistent cooking\\n\\n2. **Marination:**\\n   - Combine all marinade and spice components in a large bowl\\n   - Mix thoroughly to create a uniform marinade\\n   - Add chicken pieces and coat completely\\n   - Cover and refrigerate for minimum 4 hours (preferably overnight)\\n\\n### Phase 2: Air Fryer Execution\\n1. **Pre-Cooking Preparation:**\\n   - Preheat air fryer to 380\xc2\xb0F (193\xc2\xb0C) for 3 minutes\\n   - Remove marinated chicken from refrigerator 20 minutes before cooking\\n   - Add corn starch/rice flour and beaten egg to marinated chicken\\n   - Mix thoroughly to ensure even coating\\n\\n2. **Air Frying Process:**\\n   - Lightly spray air fryer basket with cooking spray\\n   - Arrange chicken pieces in a single layer with small gaps between pieces\\n   - Cook in batches if necessary to avoid overcrowding\\n   - Air fry at 380\xc2\xb0F for 12 minutes\\n   - Flip chicken pieces halfway through cooking (at 6-minute mark)\\n   - Check internal temperature (should reach 165\xc2\xb0F/74\xc2\xb0C)\\n\\n### Phase 3: Optional Tempering (For Authentic Finish)\\n1. **Tempering Preparation:**\\n   - Heat 1 tablespoon oil in a small pan\\n   - Add mustard seeds and let them splutter\\n   - Add dried red chilies, curry leaves, green chilies, and minced garlic\\n   - Saut\xc3\xa9 for 30 seconds until aromatic\\n\\n2. **Final Assembly:**\\n   - Transfer air-fried chicken to a mixing bowl\\n   - Pour the tempering mixture over the chicken\\n   - Toss gently to coat evenly\\n   - Garnish with chopped cilantro\\n   - Serve hot with lemon wedges\\n\\n## Key Performance Indicators\\n\\n### Texture Metrics:\\n- Exterior should be crispy and lightly browned\\n- Interior should remain juicy and tender\\n- Chicken should be fully cooked (165\xc2\xb0F/74\xc2\xb0C internal temperature)\\n\\n### Flavor Metrics:\\n- Medium spice level that provides warmth without overwhelming heat\\n- Balanced flavor profile with tangy, spicy, and aromatic elements\\n- Authentic curry leaf and mustard seed notes\\n\\n### Appearance Metrics:\\n- Vibrant reddish-orange color\\n- Even browning\\n- Visible spice coating\\n\\n## Risk Mitigation\\n\\n### Potential Issues and Solutions:\\n1. **Undercooking:**\\n   - Solution: Use a meat thermometer to verify internal temperature\\n   - Contingency: Add 2-3 minutes additional cooking time if needed\\n\\n2. **Dry Texture:**\\n   - Solution: Ensure adequate marination time (minimum 4 hours)\\n   - Contingency: Rest chicken at room temperature 20 minutes before cooking\\n\\n3. **Insufficient Crispiness:**\\n   - Solution: Ensure chicken pieces aren\'t overcrowded in air fryer\\n   - Contingency: Increase temperature to 400\xc2\xb0F for last 2 minutes of cooking\\n\\n4. **Spice Level Adjustment:**\\n   - Solution: Prepare a small sample piece to test spice level\\n   - Contingency: Add yogurt-based dipping sauce to moderate heat if too spicy\\n\\n## Implementation Schedule\\n\\n1. **Day Before:**\\n   - The strategy focuses on maintaining authentic flavors while adapting the traditional deep-frying method to a healthier air fryer approach.\\n\\n## Requirements Analysis\\n\\n### Key Requirements:\\n- Prepare Chicken 65\\n- Medium spice level\\n- Yield: 4-5 servings\\n- Cooking method: Air fryer\\n- Minimal oil usage\\n\\n### Constraints:\\n- Must retain authentic Chicken 65 flavor profile\\n- Must achieve proper texture (crispy exterior, juicy interior)\\n- Must accommodate medium spice tolerance\\n- Must be efficiently prepared using an air fryer\\n\\n## Ingredient Strategy\\n\\n### Primary Ingredients:\\n- **Chicken:** 1.5 pounds (700g) boneless chicken thighs, cut into 1-inch cubes\\n- **Marinade Base:**\\n  - 1 cup plain yogurt\\n  - 2 tablespoons lemon juice\\n  - 1 tablespoon ginger-garlic paste\\n  - 1 teaspoon salt\\n\\n### Spice Components (Medium Level):\\n- 1.5 teaspoons Kashmiri red chili powder (provides color with moderate heat)\\n- 1 teaspoon regular red chili powder (can be adjusted \xc2\xb10.5 tsp for spice preference)\\n- 1 teaspoon coriander powder\\n- 1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder\\n- 1/2 teaspoon garam masala\\n- 1/4 teaspoon black pepper\\n\\n### Coating Components:\\n- 3 tablespoons corn starch or rice flour\\n- 1 egg (beaten)\\n\\n### Oil Usage Strategy:\\n- 2 tablespoons oil for marination\\n- Cooking spray for air fryer basket\\n\\n### Tempering/Garnish Components:\\n- 1 tablespoon oil\\n- 2-3 dried red chilies (optional)\\n- 10-12 curry leaves\\n- 2 green chilies, slit (optional - for authentic appearance)\\n- 1 tablespoon minced garlic\\n- 1/2 teaspoon mustard seeds\\n- Chopped cilantro for garnish\\n- Lemon wedges for serving\\n\\n## Process Flow Diagram\\n\\n```\\n[Chicken Preparation] \xe2\x86\x92 [Marination (4+ hours)] \xe2\x86\x92 [Add Coating] \xe2\x86\x92 [Air Fry] \xe2\x86\x92 [Optional Tempering] \xe2\x86\x92 [Garnish and Serve]\\n```\\n\\n## Detailed Process Strategy\\n\\n### Phase 1: Preparation and Marination\\n1. **Chicken Preparation:**\\n   - Clean and pat dry chicken pieces\\n   - Cut into 1-inch cubes for even cooking\\n   - Ensure uniform size for consistent cooking\\n\\n2. **Marination:**\\n   - Combine all marinade and spice components in a large bowl\\n   - Mix thoroughly to create a uniform marinade\\n   - Add chicken pieces and coat completely\\n   - Cover and refrigerate for minimum 4 hours (preferably overnight)\\n\\n### Phase 2: Air Fryer Execution\\n1. **Pre-Cooking Preparation:**\\n   - Preheat air fryer to 380\xc2\xb0F (193\xc2\xb0C) for 3 minutes\\n   - Remove marinated chicken from refrigerator 20 minutes before cooking\\n   - Add corn starch/rice flour and beaten egg to marinated chicken\\n   - Mix thoroughly to ensure even coating\\n\\n2. **Air Frying Process:**\\n   - Lightly spray air fryer basket with cooking spray\\n   - Arrange chicken pieces in a single layer with small gaps between pieces\\n   - Cook in batches if necessary to avoid overcrowding\\n   - Air fry at 380\xc2\xb0F for 12 minutes\\n   - Flip chicken pieces halfway through cooking (at 6-minute mark)\\n   - Check internal temperature (should reach 165\xc2\xb0F/74\xc2\xb0C)\\n\\n### Phase 3: Optional Tempering (For Authentic Finish)\\n1. **Tempering Preparation:**\\n   - Heat 1 tablespoon oil in a small pan\\n   - Add mustard seeds and let them splutter\\n   - Add dried red chilies, curry leaves, green chilies, and minced garlic\\n   - Saut\xc3\xa9 for 30 seconds until aromatic\\n\\n2. **Final Assembly:**\\n   - Transfer air-fried chicken to a mixing bowl\\n   - Pour the tempering mixture over the chicken\\n   - Toss gently to coat evenly\\n   - Garnish with chopped cilantro\\n   - Serve hot with lemon wedges\\n\\n## Key Performance Indicators\\n\\n### Texture Metrics:\\n- Exterior should be crispy and lightly browned\\n- Interior should remain juicy and tender\\n- Chicken should be fully cooked (165\xc2\xb0F/74\xc2\xb0C internal temperature)\\n\\n### Flavor Metrics:\\n- Medium spice level that provides warmth without overwhelming heat\\n- Balanced flavor profile with tangy, spicy, and aromatic elements\\n- Authentic curry leaf and mustard seed notes\\n\\n### Appearance Metrics:\\n- Vibrant reddish-orange color\\n- Even browning\\n- Visible spice coating\\n\\n## Risk Mitigation\\n\\n### Potential Issues and Solutions:\\n1. **Undercooking:**\\n   - Solution: Use a meat thermometer to verify internal temperature\\n   - Contingency: Add 2-3 minutes additional cooking time if needed\\n\\n2. **Dry Texture:**\\n   - Solution: Ensure adequate marination time (minimum 4 hours)\\n   - Contingency: Rest chicken at room temperature 20 minutes before cooking\\n\\n3. **Insufficient Crispiness:**\\n   - Solution: Ensure chicken pieces aren\'t overcrowded in air fryer\\n   - Contingency: Increase temperature to 400\xc2\xb0F for last 2 minutes of cooking\\n\\n4. **Spice Level Adjustment:**\\n   - Prepare air fryer and additional coating ingredients\\n   - Cook chicken in batches as needed\\n   - Prepare tempering if desired\\n   - Garnish and serve immediately\\n\\n## Conclusion\\nThis strategy provides a comprehensive approach to creating Chicken 65 that balances authentic flavor with healthier cooking methods. The strategy focuses on maintaining authentic flavors while adapting the traditional deep-frying method to a healthier air fryer approach.\\n\\n## Requirements Analysis\\n\\n### Key Requirements:\\n- Prepare Chicken 65\\n- Medium spice level\\n- Yield: 4-5 servings\\n- Cooking method: Air fryer\\n- Minimal oil usage\\n\\n### Constraints:\\n- Must retain authentic Chicken 65 flavor profile\\n- Must achieve proper texture (crispy exterior, juicy interior)\\n- Must accommodate medium spice tolerance\\n- Must be efficiently prepared using an air fryer\\n\\n## Ingredient Strategy\\n\\n### Primary Ingredients:\\n- **Chicken:** 1.5 pounds (700g) boneless chicken thighs, cut into 1-inch cubes\\n- **Marinade Base:**\\n  - 1 cup plain yogurt\\n  - 2 tablespoons lemon juice\\n  - 1 tablespoon ginger-garlic paste\\n  - 1 teaspoon salt\\n\\n### Spice Components (Medium Level):\\n- 1.5 teaspoons Kashmiri red chili powder (provides color with moderate heat)\\n- 1 teaspoon regular red chili powder (can be adjusted \xc2\xb10.5 tsp for spice preference)\\n- 1 teaspoon coriander powder\\n- 1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder\\n- 1/2 teaspoon garam masala\\n- 1/4 teaspoon black pepper\\n\\n### Coating Components:\\n- 3 tablespoons corn starch or rice flour\\n- 1 egg (beaten)\\n\\n### Oil Usage Strategy:\\n- 2 tablespoons oil for marination\\n- Cooking spray for air fryer basket\\n\\n### Tempering/Garnish Components:\\n- 1 tablespoon oil\\n- 2-3 dried red chilies (optional)\\n- 10-12 curry leaves\\n- 2 green chilies, slit (optional - for authentic appearance)\\n- 1 tablespoon minced garlic\\n- 1/2 teaspoon mustard seeds\\n- Chopped cilantro for garnish\\n- Lemon wedges for serving\\n\\n## Process Flow Diagram\\n\\n```\\n[Chicken Preparation] \xe2\x86\x92 [Marination (4+ hours)] \xe2\x86\x92 [Add Coating] \xe2\x86\x92 [Air Fry] \xe2\x86\x92 [Optional Tempering] \xe2\x86\x92 [Garnish and Serve]\\n```\\n\\n## Detailed Process Strategy\\n\\n### Phase 1: Preparation and Marination\\n1. **Chicken Preparation:**\\n   - Clean and pat dry chicken pieces\\n   - Cut into 1-inch cubes for even cooking\\n   - Ensure uniform size for consistent cooking\\n\\n2. **Marination:**\\n   - Combine all marinade and spice components in a large bowl\\n   - Mix thoroughly to create a uniform marinade\\n   - Add chicken pieces and coat completely\\n   - Cover and refrigerate for minimum 4 hours (preferably overnight)\\n\\n### Phase 2: Air Fryer Execution\\n1. **Pre-Cooking Preparation:**\\n   - Preheat air fryer to 380\xc2\xb0F (193\xc2\xb0C) for 3 minutes\\n   - Remove marinated chicken from refrigerator 20 minutes before cooking\\n   - Add corn starch/rice flour and beaten egg to marinated chicken\\n   - Mix thoroughly to ensure even coating\\n\\n2. **Air Frying Process:**\\n   - Lightly spray air fryer basket with cooking spray\\n   - Arrange chicken pieces in a single layer with small gaps between pieces\\n   - Cook in batches if necessary to avoid overcrowding\\n   - Air fry at 380\xc2\xb0F for 12 minutes\\n   - Flip chicken pieces halfway through cooking (at 6-minute mark)\\n   - Check internal temperature (should reach 165\xc2\xb0F/74\xc2\xb0C)\\n\\n### Phase 3: Optional Tempering (For Authentic Finish)\\n1. **Tempering Preparation:**\\n   - Heat 1 tablespoon oil in a small pan\\n   - Add mustard seeds and let them splutter\\n   - Add dried red chilies, curry leaves, green chilies, and minced garlic\\n   - Saut\xc3\xa9 for 30 seconds until aromatic\\n\\n2. **Final Assembly:**\\n   - Transfer air-fried chicken to a mixing bowl\\n   - Pour the tempering mixture over the chicken\\n   - Toss gently to coat evenly\\n   - Garnish with chopped cilantro\\n   - Serve hot with lemon wedges\\n\\n## Key Performance Indicators\\n\\n### Texture Metrics:\\n- Exterior should be crispy and lightly browned\\n- Interior should remain juicy and tender\\n- Chicken should be fully cooked (165\xc2\xb0F/74\xc2\xb0C internal temperature)\\n\\n### Flavor Metrics:\\n- Medium spice level that provides warmth without overwhelming heat\\n- Balanced flavor profile with tangy, spicy, and aromatic elements\\n- Authentic curry leaf and mustard seed notes\\n\\n### Appearance Metrics:\\n- Vibrant reddish-orange color\\n- Even browning\\n- Visible spice coating\\n\\n## Risk Mitigation\\n\\n### Potential Issues and Solutions:\\n1. **Undercooking:**\\n   - Solution: Use a meat thermometer to verify internal temperature\\n   - Contingency: Add 2-3 minutes additional cooking time if needed\\n\\n2. **Dry Texture:**\\n   - Solution: Ensure adequate marination time (minimum 4 hours)\\n   - Contingency: Rest chicken at room temperature 20 minutes before cooking\\n\\n3. **Insufficient Crispiness:**\\n   - Solution: Ensure chicken pieces aren\'t overcrowded in air fryer\\n   - Contingency: Increase temperature to 400\xc2\xb0F for last 2 minutes of cooking\\n\\n4. **Spice Level Adjustment:**\\n   - Solution: Prepare a small sample piece to test spice level\\n   - Contingency: Add yogurt-based dipping sauce to moderate heat if too spicy\\n\\n## Implementation Schedule\\n\\n1. **Day Before:**\\n   - Purchase ingredients\\n   - Clean and cut chicken\\n   - Prepare marinade and combine with chicken\\n   - Refrigerate overnight\\n\\n2. **Day of Serving:**\\n   - Remove chicken from refrigerator 20 minutes before cooking\\n   - Prepare air fryer and additional coating ingredients\\n   - Cook chicken in batches as needed\\n   - Prepare tempering if desired\\n   - Garnish and serve immediately\\n\\n## Conclusion\\nThis strategy provides a comprehensive approach to creating Chicken 65 that balances authentic flavor with healthier cooking methods. By following this document, you will achieve a medium-spiced Chicken 65 with minimal oil usage while maintaining the dish\'s essential characteristics and serving 4-5 people effectively.\\n\\n---\\n/Users/sysadmin/Desktop/projects/rabbithole-v2/data/files/clarifications.md:\\n# Customer Intent\\nI want to turn off my laptop.\\n\\n# Clarifying Questions and Answers\\n1. The strategy focuses on maintaining authentic flavors while adapting the traditional deep-frying method to a healthier air fryer approach.\\n\\n## Requirements Analysis\\n\\n### Key Requirements:\\n- Prepare Chicken 65\\n- Medium spice level\\n- Yield: 4-5 servings\\n- Cooking method: Air fryer\\n- Minimal oil usage\\n\\n### Constraints:\\n- Must retain authentic Chicken 65 flavor profile\\n- Must achieve proper texture (crispy exterior, juicy interior)\\n- Must accommodate medium spice tolerance\\n- Must be efficiently prepared using an air fryer\\n\\n## Ingredient Strategy\\n\\n### Primary Ingredients:\\n- **Chicken:** 1.5 pounds (700g) boneless chicken thighs, cut into 1-inch cubes\\n- **Marinade Base:**\\n  - 1 cup plain yogurt\\n  - 2 tablespoons lemon juice\\n  - 1 tablespoon ginger-garlic paste\\n  - 1 teaspoon salt\\n\\n### Spice Components (Medium Level):\\n- 1.5 teaspoons Kashmiri red chili powder (provides color with moderate heat)\\n- 1 teaspoon regular red chili powder (can be adjusted \xc2\xb10.5 tsp for spice preference)\\n- 1 teaspoon coriander powder\\n- 1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder\\n- 1/2 teaspoon garam masala\\n- 1/4 teaspoon black pepper\\n\\n### Coating Components:\\n- 3 tablespoons corn starch or rice flour\\n- 1 egg (beaten)\\n\\n### Oil Usage Strategy:\\n- 2 tablespoons oil for marination\\n- Cooking spray for air fryer basket\\n\\n### Tempering/Garnish Components:\\n- 1 tablespoon oil\\n- 2-3 dried red chilies (optional)\\n- 10-12 curry leaves\\n- 2 green chilies, slit (optional - for authentic appearance)\\n- 1 tablespoon minced garlic\\n- 1/2 teaspoon mustard seeds\\n- Chopped cilantro for garnish\\n- Lemon wedges for serving\\n\\n## Process Flow Diagram\\n\\n```\\n[Chicken Preparation] \xe2\x86\x92 [Marination (4+ hours)] \xe2\x86\x92 [Add Coating] \xe2\x86\x92 [Air Fry] \xe2\x86\x92 [Optional Tempering] \xe2\x86\x92 [Garnish and Serve]\\n```\\n\\n## Detailed Process Strategy\\n\\n### Phase 1: Preparation and Marination\\n1. **Chicken Preparation:**\\n   - Clean and pat dry chicken pieces\\n   - Cut into 1-inch cubes for even cooking\\n   - Ensure uniform size for consistent cooking\\n\\n2. **Marination:**\\n   - Combine all marinade and spice components in a large bowl\\n   - Mix thoroughly to create a uniform marinade\\n   - Add chicken pieces and coat completely\\n   - Cover and refrigerate for minimum 4 hours (preferably overnight)\\n\\n### Phase 2: Air Fryer Execution\\n1. **Pre-Cooking Preparation:**\\n   - Preheat air fryer to 380\xc2\xb0F (193\xc2\xb0C) for 3 minutes\\n   - Remove marinated chicken from refrigerator 20 minutes before cooking\\n   - Add corn starch/rice flour and beaten egg to marinated chicken\\n   - Mix thoroughly to ensure even coating\\n\\n2. **Air Frying Process:**\\n   - Lightly spray air fryer basket with cooking spray\\n   - Arrange chicken pieces in a single layer with small gaps between pieces\\n   - Cook in batches if necessary to avoid overcrowding\\n   - Air fry at 380\xc2\xb0F for 12 minutes\\n   - Flip chicken pieces halfway through cooking (at 6-minute mark)\\n   - Check internal temperature (should reach 165\xc2\xb0F/74\xc2\xb0C)\\n\\n### Phase 3: Optional Tempering (For Authentic Finish)\\n1. **Tempering Preparation:**\\n   - Heat 1 tablespoon oil in a small pan\\n   - Add mustard seeds and let them splutter\\n   - Add dried red chilies, curry leaves, green chilies, and minced garlic\\n   - Saut\xc3\xa9 for 30 seconds until aromatic\\n\\n2. **Final Assembly:**\\n   - Transfer air-fried chicken to a mixing bowl\\n   - Pour the tempering mixture over the chicken\\n   - Toss gently to coat evenly\\n   - Garnish with chopped cilantro\\n   - Serve hot with lemon wedges\\n\\n## Key Performance Indicators\\n\\n### Texture Metrics:\\n- Exterior should be crispy and lightly browned\\n- Interior should remain juicy and tender\\n- Chicken should be fully cooked (165\xc2\xb0F/74\xc2\xb0C internal temperature)\\n\\n### Flavor Metrics:\\n- Medium spice level that provides warmth without overwhelming heat\\n- Balanced flavor profile with tangy, spicy, and aromatic elements\\n- Authentic curry leaf and mustard seed notes\\n\\n### Appearance Metrics:\\n- Vibrant reddish-orange color\\n- Even browning\\n- Visible spice coating\\n\\n## Risk Mitigation\\n\\n### Potential Issues and Solutions:\\n1. **Undercooking:**\\n   - The strategy focuses on maintaining authentic flavors while adapting the traditional deep-frying method to a healthier air fryer approach.\\n\\n## Requirements Analysis\\n\\n### Key Requirements:\\n- Prepare Chicken 65\\n- Medium spice level\\n- Yield: 4-5 servings\\n- Cooking method: Air fryer\\n- Minimal oil usage\\n\\n### Constraints:\\n- Must retain authentic Chicken 65 flavor profile\\n- Must achieve proper texture (crispy exterior, juicy interior)\\n- Must accommodate medium spice tolerance\\n- Must be efficiently prepared using an air fryer\\n\\n## Ingredient Strategy\\n\\n### Primary Ingredients:\\n- **Chicken:** 1.5 pounds (700g) boneless chicken thighs, cut into 1-inch cubes\\n- **Marinade Base:**\\n  - 1 cup plain yogurt\\n  - 2 tablespoons lemon juice\\n  - 1 tablespoon ginger-garlic paste\\n  - 1 teaspoon salt\\n\\n### Spice Components (Medium Level):\\n- 1.5 teaspoons Kashmiri red chili powder (provides color with moderate heat)\\n- 1 teaspoon regular red chili powder (can be adjusted \xc2\xb10.5 tsp for spice preference)\\n- 1 teaspoon coriander powder\\n- 1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder\\n- 1/2 teaspoon garam masala\\n- 1/4 teaspoon black pepper\\n\\n### Coating Components:\\n- 3 tablespoons corn starch or rice flour\\n- 1 egg (beaten)\\n\\n### Oil Usage Strategy:\\n- 2 tablespoons oil for marination\\n- Cooking spray for air fryer basket\\n\\n### Tempering/Garnish Components:\\n- 1 tablespoon oil\\n- 2-3 dried red chilies (optional)\\n- 10-12 curry leaves\\n- 2 green chilies, slit (optional - for authentic appearance)\\n- 1 tablespoon minced garlic\\n- 1/2 teaspoon mustard seeds\\n- Chopped cilantro for garnish\\n- Lemon wedges for serving\\n\\n## Process Flow Diagram\\n\\n```\\n[Chicken Preparation] \xe2\x86\x92 [Marination (4+ hours)] \xe2\x86\x92 [Add Coating] \xe2\x86\x92 [Air Fry] \xe2\x86\x92 [Optional Tempering] \xe2\x86\x92 [Garnish and Serve]\\n```\\n\\n## Detailed Process Strategy\\n\\n### Phase 1: Preparation and Marination\\n1. **Chicken Preparation:**\\n   - Clean and pat dry chicken pieces\\n   - Cut into 1-inch cubes for even cooking\\n   - Ensure uniform size for consistent cooking\\n\\n2. **Marination:**\\n   - Combine all marinade and spice components in a large bowl\\n   - Mix thoroughly to create a uniform marinade\\n   - Add chicken pieces and coat completely\\n   - Cover and refrigerate for minimum 4 hours (preferably overnight)\\n\\n### Phase 2: Air Fryer Execution\\n1. **Pre-Cooking Preparation:**\\n   - Preheat air fryer to 380\xc2\xb0F (193\xc2\xb0C) for 3 minutes\\n   - Remove marinated chicken from refrigerator 20 minutes before cooking\\n   - Add corn starch/rice flour and beaten egg to marinated chicken\\n   - Mix thoroughly to ensure even coating\\n\\n2. **Air Frying Process:**\\n   - Lightly spray air fryer basket with cooking spray\\n   - Arrange chicken pieces in a single layer with small gaps between pieces\\n   - Cook in batches if necessary to avoid overcrowding\\n   - Air fry at 380\xc2\xb0F for 12 minutes\\n   - Flip chicken pieces halfway through cooking (at 6-minute mark)\\n   - Check internal temperature (should reach 165\xc2\xb0F/74\xc2\xb0C)\\n\\n### Phase 3: Optional Tempering (For Authentic Finish)\\n1. **Tempering Preparation:**\\n   - Heat 1 tablespoon oil in a small pan\\n   - Add mustard seeds and let them splutter\\n   - Add dried red chilies, curry leaves, green chilies, and minced garlic\\n   - Saut\xc3\xa9 for 30 seconds until aromatic\\n\\n2. **Final Assembly:**\\n   - Transfer air-fried chicken to a mixing bowl\\n   - Pour the tempering mixture over the chicken\\n   - Toss gently to coat evenly\\n   - Garnish with chopped cilantro\\n   - Serve hot with lemon wedges\\n\\n## Key Performance Indicators\\n\\n### Texture Metrics:\\n- Exterior should be crispy and lightly browned\\n- Interior should remain juicy and tender\\n- Chicken should be fully cooked (165\xc2\xb0F/74\xc2\xb0C internal temperature)\\n\\n### Flavor Metrics:\\n- Medium spice level that provides warmth without overwhelming heat\\n- Balanced flavor profile with tangy, spicy, and aromatic elements\\n- Authentic curry leaf and mustard seed notes\\n\\n### Appearance Metrics:\\n- Vibrant reddish-orange color\\n- Even browning\\n- Visible spice coating\\n\\n## Risk Mitigation\\n\\n### Potential Issues and Solutions:\\n1. **Undercooking:**\\n   - Solution: Use a meat thermometer to verify internal temperature\\n   - Contingency: Add 2-3 minutes additional cooking time if needed\\n\\n2. **Dry Texture:**\\n   - Solution: Ensure adequate marination time (minimum 4 hours)\\n   - Contingency: Rest chicken at room temperature 20 minutes before cooking\\n\\n3. **Insufficient Crispiness:**\\n   - Solution: Ensure chicken pieces aren\'t overcrowded in air fryer\\n   - Contingency: Increase temperature to 400\xc2\xb0F for last 2 minutes of cooking\\n\\n4. **Spice Level Adjustment:**\\n   - Solution: Prepare a small sample piece to test spice level\\n   - Contingency: Add yogurt-based dipping sauce to moderate heat if too spicy\\n\\n## Implementation Schedule\\n\\n1. **Day Before:**\\n   - Purchase ingredients\\n   - Clean and cut chicken\\n   - Prepare marinade and combine with chicken\\n   - Refrigerate overnight\\n\\n2. **Day of Serving:**\\n   - Remove chicken from refrigerator 20 minutes before cooking\\n   - Prepare air fryer and additional coating ingredients\\n   - Cook chicken in batches as needed\\n   - Prepare tempering if desired\\n   - Garnish and serve immediately\\n\\n## Conclusion\\nThis strategy provides a comprehensive approach to creating Chicken 65 that balances authentic flavor with healthier cooking methods. Browser Compatibility\\n\\nThis implementation is compatible with all modern web browsers including:\\n- Google Chrome (any recent version)\\n- Mozilla Firefox (any recent version)\\n- Safari (any recent version)\\n- Microsoft Edge (any recent version)\\n- Opera (any recent version)\\n\\nNo special accommodations or browser-specific code is required.\\n\\n## 6. Testing Strategy\\n\\n### Test Cases\\n\\n| Test ID | Description | Expected Result | Browser |\\n|---------|-------------|-----------------|---------|\\n| TC-01 | Execute script in Chrome console | \\"Hello World\\" displayed in console | Chrome |\\n| TC-02 | Execute script in Firefox console | \\"Hello World\\" displayed in console | Firefox |\\n| TC-03 | Execute script in Safari console | \\"Hello World\\" displayed in console | Safari |\\n| TC-04 | Execute script in Edge console | \\"Hello World\\" displayed in console | Edge |\\n\\n### Verification Method\\n- Manual testing by executing the script in each browser\'s console\\n- Visual confirmation that \\"Hello World\\" appears in the console output\\n\\n## 7. Educational Extensions\\n\\nWhile not required by the core requirements, these extensions offer learning opportunities:\\n\\n### Alternative Implementations\\n```javascript\\n// Using alert() instead of console.log()\\nalert(\\"Hello World\\");\\n\\n// Using document.write() to display on the webpage\\ndocument.write(\\"Hello World\\");\\n\\n// Using innerHTML to modify page content\\ndocument.body.innerHTML = \\"

Implementation should use standard JavaScript that works in Chrome\\n\\n### Customer Context\\n- The purpose is \\"just testing\\"\\n- The customer has expertise in JavaScript and Chrome\\n- No specific styling or advanced features are required\\n- The implementation needs to be simple and straightforward\\n\\n## Implementation Strategy\\n\\n### Two-File Solution\\n\\n#### index.html\\n```html\\n\\n\\n\\n \\n \\n Hello World - Two File Solution\\n\\n\\n

Hello World
\\n \\n \\n\\n\\n```\\n\\n## Implementation Details\\n\\n### HTML Structure\\n- Each solution includes proper HTML5 DOCTYPE declaration\\n- Meta tags for character encoding and responsive viewport\\n- Semantic structure with appropriate title\\n- Element with an ID for JavaScript to target\\n\\n### JavaScript Implementation\\n- DOM manipulation to display \\"Hello World\\" on the webpage\\n- Console logging (in the two-file solution)\\n- Script positioning at the end of the body to ensure DOM is loaded before execution\\n- No external dependencies or libraries\\n\\n## Alternative Approaches Considered\\n\\n### For Two-File Solution\\n- **Window.onload approach**: Could use `window.onload = function() {...}` to ensure DOM is fully loaded\\n- **DOMContentLoaded listener**: Could use `document.addEventListener(\'DOMContentLoaded\', function() {...})`\\n- **Defer attribute**: Could add `defer` attribute to script tag\\n\\n### For Single-File Solution\\n- **Direct HTML approach**: Could simply place \\"Hello World\\" in HTML without JavaScript\\n- **Document.write()**: Could use `document.write(\\"Hello World\\")` for simpler but less recommended code\\n- **Self-executing function**: Could wrap JavaScript in `(function() {...})()` for better scoping\\n\\n## Testing Strategy\\n1. Hello World
\\n \\n \\n\\n\\n```\\n\\n## Implementation Details\\n\\n### HTML Structure\\n- Each solution includes proper HTML5 DOCTYPE declaration\\n- Meta tags for character encoding and responsive viewport\\n- Semantic structure with appropriate title\\n- Element with an ID for JavaScript to target\\n\\n### JavaScript Implementation\\n- DOM manipulation to display \\"Hello World\\" on the webpage\\n- Console logging (in the two-file solution)\\n- Script positioning at the end of the body to ensure DOM is loaded before execution\\n- No external dependencies or libraries\\n\\n## Alternative Approaches Considered\\n\\n### For Two-File Solution\\n- **Window.onload approach**: Could use `window.onload = function() {...}` to ensure DOM is fully loaded\\n- **DOMContentLoaded listener**: Could use `document.addEventListener(\'DOMContentLoaded\', function() {...})`\\n- **Defer attribute**: Could add `defer` attribute to script tag\\n\\n### For Single-File Solution\\n- **Direct HTML approach**: Could simply place \\"Hello World\\" in HTML without JavaScript\\n- **Document.write()**: Could use `document.write(\\"Hello World\\")` for simpler but less recommended code\\n- **Self-executing function**: Could wrap JavaScript in `(function() {...})()` for better scoping\\n\\n## Testing Strategy\\n1.
